item.title: 二手车需求带动 Carvana 第三季度业绩增长
item.description: 二手车零售商 Carvana 周三公布，受惠于强劲的二手车需求，第三季度利润和收入均有所增长。【原文：Used car retailer Carvana reported higher third-quarter profit and revenue on Wednesday, aided by strong demand for preowned vehicles.】

item.title: 广告和云计算需求强劲，Alphabet 季度收入超出预期
item.description: 谷歌母公司 Alphabet 周三公布的第三季度营收超出华尔街预期，原因是其核心广告业务和云计算部门均实现了稳步增长。【原文：Google-parent Alphabet beat Wall Street estimates for third-quarter revenue on Wednesday, as both its core advertising business and cloud computing unit showed steady growth.】

item.title: 微软云计算业务激增，营收超出预期
item.description: 微软周三公布了其云计算业务的大幅增长，使其季度收入超过了华尔街的预期，这表明尽管存在泡沫的担忧，但企业仍在为人工智能服务挥金如土。【原文：Microsoft reported blockbuster growth in its cloud-computing business on Wednesday that pushed its quarterly revenue past Wall Street estimates, showing businesses are still splurging on artificial intelligence services despite fears of a bubble.】

item.title: 据《财富》报道，万事达卡准备以近 20 亿美元的价格收购加密货币公司 Zerohash
item.description: 据《财富》周三报道，万事达卡（Mastercard）正处于收购加密初创公司 Zerohash 的后期谈判阶段，收购价格在 15 亿至 20 亿美元之间。【原文：Mastercard is in late-stage talks to acquire crypto startup Zerohash for between $1.5 billion and $2 billion, Fortune reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 英伟达黄仁勋加入资助特朗普的科技巨头行列
item.description: 英伟达（Nvidia）首席执行官黄仁勋告诉记者，他与其他支持该项目的科技界领袖一起，为美国总统唐纳德-特朗普的白宫宴会厅建设捐款。 "他周二在华盛顿对记者说："我很高兴能参与其中。 在白宫上周公布的捐赠者公开名单中，英伟达（Nvidia）并未榜上有名。今年 5 月，黄仁勋的个人净资产估计为 1,200 亿美元。 拆除工人拆掉了白宫东翼，为新宴会厅让路。特朗普表示，该项目将耗资 3 亿美元。亚马逊（Amazon）、苹果（Apple）和谷歌（Google）等科技公司也支持这项工程。 Nvidia 周三成为首家市值达到 5 万亿美元的公司。该公司是全球人工智能产业的中心。【原文：Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang donated to fund the construction of U.S. President Donald Trump’s White House ballroom, he told reporters, joining other tech leaders supporting the project. “I’m delighted to be part of it,” he told reporters in Washington on Tuesday. Nvidia was not named on the White House’s public list of donors released last week. Huang's personal net worth was estimated at $120 billion in May. Demolition workers tore down the East Wing of the White House to make way for the new ballroom. Trump has said the project will cost $300 million. Amazon, Apple and Google are among the technology companies also supporting the construction. Nvidia on Wednesday became the first company to reach $5 trillion in market value. The company is at the center of the global AI industry.】

item.title: 嘉吉公司将在明尼苏达州裁员 80 人，并在全球范围内裁员更多
item.description: 美国农业综合企业嘉吉公司（CARG.UL）周三表示，它将在明尼苏达州永久性裁员80人，全球裁员人数不详，这是农业公司受更广泛的农业行业不景气影响而出现的最新一波裁员潮。【原文：U.S. agribusiness Cargill Inc (CARG.UL) said Wednesday it is permanently laying off 80 employees in Minnesota and an undisclosed number globally in the latest wave of job cuts among agricultural companies hit by a broader farm sector slump.】

item.title: 致命事故发生后，NTSB 敦促部分 Learjet 机型的机主检查主起落架
item.description: 美国国家运输安全委员会周三向10种型号庞巴迪里尔喷气飞机的运营商发出紧急建议，要求确保主起落架连接正确。【原文：The National Transportation Safety Board on Wednesday issued an urgent recommendation to operators of 10 Bombardier Learjet airplanes models to ensure main landing gear are attached correctly.】

item.title: VIEW 美联储实现预期降息；鲍威尔称不保证 12 月降息
item.description: 在货币市场出现流动性变得稀缺的迹象之后，意见分歧的美国联邦储备委员会周三将利率下调了四分之一个百分点，并宣布将重新开始有限度地购买国债。【原文：A divided U.S. Federal Reserve cut interest rates by a quarter of a percentage point on Wednesday and announced it will restart limited purchases of Treasury securities after money markets showed signs that liquidity was becoming scarce, a condition the U.S. central bank has pledged to avoid.】

item.title: 能访问最大电信公司的美国公司发现了民族国家黑客的漏洞
item.description: Ribbon Communications 是美国一家重要的电信服务公司，该公司发言人周三在一份声明中证实，为一个未具名的民族国家工作的黑客入侵了该公司的网络，并在该公司的系统中停留了近一年而未被发现。【原文：Hackers working for an unnamed nation-state breached networks at Ribbon Communications , a key U.S. telecommunications services company, and remained within the firm’s systems for nearly a year without being detected, a company spokesperson confirmed in a statement on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美联储将于 12 月 1 日结束缩减资产负债表
item.description: 美联储周三表示，将结束缩减其 6.6 万亿美元的资产负债表，因为有证据表明货币市场的流动性状况已经开始收紧，银行准备金水平也在下降。【原文：The Federal Reserve on Wednesday said it is ending the drawdown of its $6.6 trillion balance sheet amid evidence money market liquidity conditions have begun tightening and bank reserve levels dropping.】

item.title: 美联储双向异议的历史
item.description: 美联储周三决定将利率下调四分之一个百分点，但有两位决策者投了反对票，一位赞成更大幅度的降息，另一位则倾向于不降息。【原文：The Federal Reserve's decision on Wednesday to lower interest rates by a quarter percentage point was met with dissenting votes by two policymakers, one favoring a larger cut and another preferring no reduction at all, a rare example over the last few decades of multiple dissents in opposing directions.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称，特朗普实施制裁后，德国正在研究将俄罗斯石油公司的业务国有化
item.description: 两位熟悉谈判情况的消息人士告诉路透社，美国对俄罗斯石油生产商俄罗斯石油公司（Rosneft）的制裁重燃了德国关于将该公司在德国的业务国有化的讨论，其中包括柏林大部分燃料都依赖的一家炼油厂。【原文：U.S. sanctions on Russian oil producer Rosneft have rekindled discussions in Germany about nationalising the company's business there, including a refinery that Berlin depends on for most of its fuel, two sources familiar with the talks told Reuters.】

item.title: 美国法官质疑阿根廷 YPF 公司案是否属于美国
item.description: 本周三，至少有两名美国法官在审议阿根廷在2012年夺取国有石油公司YPF的控制权后是否必须向投资者支付161亿美元的问题时，质疑此案是否属于美国。【原文：At least two U.S. judges on a panel considering whether Argentina must pay investors $16.1 billion after seizing control of state-owned oil company YPF in 2012 questioned on Wednesday whether the case belonged in the United States.】

item.title: 美国法官暂时阻止消费者机构的 "开放银行 "规则
item.description: 一个银行业团体联盟说服了一名联邦法官，暂时阻止了美国消费者金融保护局一项旨在使消费者更容易更换金融服务提供商的规定的执行。【原文：A coalition of banking groups has convinced a federal judge to temporarily block enforcement of a U.S. Consumer Financial Protection Bureau rule aimed at making it easier for consumers to switch financial-service providers.】

item.title: 联邦关门可能给美国经济造成高达 140 亿美元的损失
item.description: 无党派的国会预算办公室周三表示，联邦政府停摆可能会给美国经济造成 70 亿至 140 亿美元的损失，第四季度国内生产总值最多会因政府支出减少 2%。【原文：The federal government shutdown could cost the U.S. economy between $7 billion and $14 billion, shaving up to 2% from gross domestic product in the fourth quarter due to the lapse in government spending, the nonpartisan Congressional Budget Office said on Wednesday.】

item.title: 空中客车公司第三季度业绩超出预期，但下调 A220 生产目标
item.description: 欧洲空中客车公司周三公布的第三季度利润和收入均高于预期，主要原因是商用喷气式客机的交付以及直升机和防务领域的强劲增长。【原文：Europe's Airbus on Wednesday reported higher than expected third-quarter profits and revenues led by commercial jetliner deliveries and robust gains in helicopters and defence.】

item.title: 阿拉斯加航空公司称网站和应用程序瘫痪
item.description: 阿拉斯加航空公司（Alaska Airlines）表示，在全美航班因技术故障停飞数日后，其网站和应用程序于周三出现故障。【原文：Alaska Airlines said its website and app was down on Wednesday, days after a technology outage grounded its flights across the U.S.】

item.title: 专家称，将英伟达的 "布莱克威尔"（Blackwell）芯片提供给中国将削弱美国的人工智能优势
item.description: 如果特朗普政府允许英伟达（Nvidia）向中国出售其最佳人工智能芯片的一个版本，正如总统周三所敞开的大门一样，专家们表示，这将严重削弱美国在人工智能领域的优势。【原文：If the Trump administration allows Nvidia to sell a version of its best AI chip to China, as the President opened the door to on Wednesday, experts say it would severely decrease the American advantage in artificial intelligence.】

item.title: 教育科技公司 Stride 因招生问题股价暴跌
item.description: 本周三，Stride 公司发布了一份黯淡的年度收入预测，称其平台在招收新生方面举步维艰，导致其市值损失约一半。【原文：Stride lost about half of its market value on Wednesday after the edutech company issued a dour annual revenue forecast, citing struggles to enroll new students on its platform.】

item.title: 美联储常备回购机制创历史新高，政策会议结果迫在眉睫
item.description: 美联储的常备回购机制周三创下了自 2021 年推出以来的最高使用率，因为人们普遍预期央行行长们将宣布结束缩减资产负债表。【原文：The Federal Reserve's Standing Repo Facility on Wednesday recorded the highest level of usage since its launch in 2021, as central bankers are widely expected to announce an end to their balance sheet drawdown.】

item.title: Downdetector 显示，微软 Azure 和 365 有数千名用户宕机
item.description: 根据故障跟踪网站 Downdetector.com 的数据，本周三微软的 Azure 及其生产力软件套件导致数千用户宕机。【原文：Microsoft's Azure and its suite of productivity software were down for thousands of users on Wednesday, according to outage tracking website Downdetector.com.】

item.title: 解说：为什么 Nexperia 会成为汽车芯片危机的中心？
item.description: 荷兰和中国就芯片制造商 Nexperia 的对峙引发了全球汽车制造商的近乎危机，威胁到生产，暴露了供应链风险。【原文：A standoff between the Netherlands and China over chipmaker Nexperia has sparked a near crisis for global carmakers that has threatened production, laying bare supply chain risks.】

item.title: 意大利 Bending Spoons 收购 AOL，获得 28 亿美元债务融资
item.description: 意大利科技公司 Bending Spoons 周三表示，它将从雅虎手中收购美国在线（AOL），雅虎由阿波罗全球管理公司（Apollo Global Management）支持，为其不断增长的数字业务组合增添了一个历史悠久的互联网品牌。【原文：Italian tech company Bending Spoons said on Wednesday it will acquire AOL from Yahoo, which is backed by Apollo Global Management , adding a storied internet brand to its growing portfolio of digital businesses.】

item.title: 2035 年后美国核能发电量将增长 27%，数据中心将推动电力需求：WoodMac
item.description: 伍德麦肯兹公司（Wood Mackenzie）的分析师说，随着数据中心带动的需求激增使全国各地的电网紧张，以及一大批科技公司签署了从零碳资源中获取电力的协议，美国的核能发电量必将上升。【原文：U.S. nuclear power generation is set to rise, analysts at Wood Mackenzie said, as surging demand driven by data centers strains grids across the country and a wave of tech companies sign deals to source power from the zero-carbon resource.】

item.title: 据《底特律新闻》报道，通用汽车将在电动汽车工厂裁员 1200 多人
item.description: 据《底特律新闻》周三报道，通用汽车公司将在底特律的电动汽车工厂裁员1200人，并在田纳西州和俄亥俄州的电池工厂再裁员数百人。【原文：General Motors will cut 1,200 jobs at its EV plant in Detroit, and hundreds more at its Tennessee and Ohio battery facilities, Detroit News reported on Wednesday.】

item.title: 美国政府停摆可能促使通胀保值债券首次出现变通办法
item.description: 由于美国政府停摆，10 月份的通胀报告有可能被冻结，预计财政部将采取变通方法计算支撑 2.1 万亿美元通胀保值债券市场的指数，这是自 1997 年推出通胀保值债券以来的首次，此举可能会在交易员调整计算方法时造成定价怪圈。【原文：With the U.S. government shutdown threatening to freeze October’s inflation report, the Treasury is expected to deploy a workaround to compute the index underpinning the $2.1 trillion market for inflation-protected bonds for the first time since their 1997 launch, a move that may cause pricing quirks as traders adjust their calculations.】

item.title: 超微新子公司将为美国政府提供人工智能服务器支持
item.description: 人工智能服务器制造商超微计算机公司（Super Micro Computer）周三表示，该公司已成立了一家面向美国联邦机构的子公司，以推动政府提高效率。【原文：Artificial intelligence server maker Super Micro Computer on Wednesday said it has created a subsidiary catering to U.S. federal agencies, amid a drive to increase efficiency in the government.】

item.title: 礼来公司将在波多黎各投资 12 亿美元，推动美国制造业发展
item.description: 礼来公司（Eli Lilly）周三表示，将投资超过 12 亿美元扩建其在波多黎各的生产基地，该制药商希望提高其在美国的生产能力，以对冲潜在的关税。【原文：Eli Lilly said on Wednesday it will invest more than $1.2 billion to expand its manufacturing site in Puerto Rico, as the drugmaker looks to increase its U.S. production capacity to hedge against potential tariffs.】

item.title: 据英国《金融时报》报道，约翰-马龙将卸任自由媒体和自由全球董事长一职
item.description: 英国《金融时报》周三援引两位知情人士的话报道称，媒体大亨约翰-马龙（John Malone）将辞去一级方程式赛车所有者自由媒体公司（Liberty Media）和自由全球公司（Liberty Global）主席一职。【原文：Media mogul John Malone will step down as chair of Formula 1 owner Liberty Media and Liberty Global , the Financial Times reported on Wednesday, citing two people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 日立能源收购美国 Shermco 公司股份，加强电网服务
item.description: 日立能源公司（Hitachi Energy）周三告诉路透社，日立能源已收购了最近被黑石集团（Blackstone）收购的美国电力服务公司 Shermco 的少数股权，该交易旨在打造北美最大的电网服务提供商。【原文：Hitachi Energy has acquired a minority stake in Shermco, a U.S. electrical services company recently bought by Blackstone , Hitachi Energy told Reuters on Wednesday, in a deal aimed at creating the largest grid services provider in North America.】
